properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 8 at 9:40PM CST until February 9 at 4:00PM CST by NWS Chicago IL
properties.description:
* WHAT...A period of moderate to heavy snow with rates of 1 inch
or more per hour possible for a short time during the mid
morning to early afternoon. Total snow accumulation of 2 to 4
inches.

* WHERE...Winnebago and Boone Counties.

* WHEN...Highest impact, heaviest snowfall is expected to
develop between 8 and 10 am and last for 2 to 4 hours before
tapering off and then possibly changing to some light rain or
drizzle.

* IMPACTS...High snow rates will likely lead to roads becoming
snow covered for a time and hazardous travel.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for Illinois can be obtained on the
internet at www.gettingaroundillinois.com.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM TO 4 PM CST SUNDAY
